trans-unit.source: Addressing Queue Service Resources
trans-unit.target: Addressing Queue Service Resources

trans-unit.source: The Queue service exposes the following resources via the REST API:
trans-unit.target: The Queue service exposes the following resources via the REST API:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Account.</ui> The storage account is a uniquely identified entity within the storage system.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Account.</ui> The storage account is a uniquely identified entity within the storage system.

trans-unit.source: The account is the parent namespace for the Queue service.
trans-unit.target: The account is the parent namespace for the Queue service.

trans-unit.source: All queues are associated with an account.
trans-unit.target: All queues are associated with an account.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Queue.</ui> A queue stores messages that may be retrieved by a client application or service.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Queue.</ui> A queue stores messages that may be retrieved by a client application or service.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Messages.</ui> Messages are UTF-8 encoded text that can be the value of an XML element.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Messages.</ui> Messages are UTF-8 encoded text that can be the value of an XML element.

trans-unit.source: A message can be 64 KB in size.
trans-unit.target: A message can be 64 KB in size.

trans-unit.source: Resource URI Syntax
trans-unit.target: Resource URI Syntax

trans-unit.source: Each resource has a corresponding base URI, which refers to the resource itself.
trans-unit.target: Each resource has a corresponding base URI, which refers to the resource itself.

trans-unit.source: For the storage account, the base URI for queue operations includes the name of the account only:
trans-unit.target: For the storage account, the base URI for queue operations includes the name of the account only:

trans-unit.source: For a queue, the base URI includes the name of the account and the name of the queue:
trans-unit.target: For a queue, the base URI includes the name of the account and the name of the queue:

trans-unit.source: For messages in a queue, the base URI includes the name of the account, the name of the queue, and the set of messages in that queue:
trans-unit.target: For messages in a queue, the base URI includes the name of the account, the name of the queue, and the set of messages in that queue:

trans-unit.source: An individual message may be updated or deleted by referring to the message ID.
trans-unit.target: An individual message may be updated or deleted by referring to the message ID.

trans-unit.source: Note that this syntax is available only to the <link xlink:href="5f574ef2-2371-4336-94de-c2cef61edb6f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Message</link> and <link xlink:href="0c7e3383-d6a5-473b-9109-101d5cc86628" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Message</link> operation and requires a <parameterReference>popreceipt</parameterReference> parameter for verification:
trans-unit.target: Note that this syntax is available only to the <link xlink:href="5f574ef2-2371-4336-94de-c2cef61edb6f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Message</link> and <link xlink:href="0c7e3383-d6a5-473b-9109-101d5cc86628" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Message</link> operation and requires a <parameterReference>popreceipt</parameterReference> parameter for verification:

trans-unit.source: Each resource may also have components, which are expressed as part of the query string on the base URI.
trans-unit.target: Each resource may also have components, which are expressed as part of the query string on the base URI.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for the query string is <codeInline>?comp=%%amp;lt;component_name%%amp;gt;</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for the query string is <codeInline>?comp=%%amp;lt;component_name%%amp;gt;</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the following resource components are available for queue resources, as parameters on the URI.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the following resource components are available for queue resources, as parameters on the URI.

trans-unit.source: Component
trans-unit.target: Component

trans-unit.source: Supported resources
trans-unit.target: Supported resources

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Account
trans-unit.target: Account

trans-unit.source: Enumerates the entities beneath this resource.
trans-unit.target: Enumerates the entities beneath this resource.

trans-unit.source: On the account, returns the list of queues.
trans-unit.target: On the account, returns the list of queues.

trans-unit.source: Queue
trans-unit.target: Queue

trans-unit.source: Sets or returns queue properties, including user-defined metadata.
trans-unit.target: Sets or returns queue properties, including user-defined metadata.

trans-unit.source: Note that all values for query parameters must be URL encoded before they are sent to the Azure storage services.
trans-unit.target: Note that all values for query parameters must be URL encoded before they are sent to the Azure storage services.

trans-unit.source: Supported HTTP Operations
trans-unit.target: Supported HTTP Operations

trans-unit.source: Each resource supports operations based on the HTTP verbs GET, PUT, HEAD, and DELETE.
trans-unit.target: Each resource supports operations based on the HTTP verbs GET, PUT, HEAD, and DELETE.

trans-unit.source: The verb, syntax, and supported HTTP version(s) for each operation appears on the reference page for each operation.
trans-unit.target: The verb, syntax, and supported HTTP version(s) for each operation appears on the reference page for each operation.

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of operation reference pages, see <link xlink:href="2793691c-e763-413d-93e7-e111312d5f4b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Queue Service REST API</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of operation reference pages, see <link xlink:href="2793691c-e763-413d-93e7-e111312d5f4b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Queue Service REST API</link>.
